meanings.definition: A filled triangular pastry typically eaten during the Jewish holiday of Purim.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious hamantasch during the Purim celebration.
meanings.sent2: During Purim, it is common to share hamantaschen with friends and family.
meanings.sent3: The hamantasch wore a tiny hat made of frosting, looking quite festive.
meanings.sent4: The hamantasch, a sweet triangle, held the memories of joyful Purim gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked hamantaschen filled the room, tempting everyone.
